result.execSummary:
The defendant Kriston B Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kriston B Jones in court with attorney Kiley Zellner.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 1 day time served, Huber privileges for work, school and treatment.  FORTHWITH.

Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $350.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges, and $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge.  Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan.  Defendant to cooperate with any treatment recommended.  Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for a period of 12 months.    Court orders defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 12 months to commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served, Huber privileges for work and treatment.  

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year with the following conditions:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $439.00 to be paid to the Greenfield Police Department.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs, fines, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Kriston B Jones in court with attorney Kiley Zellner.  Lucy Kronforst for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Stayed warrant is lifed by the Court.  

AS TO THE AMENDED COUNT 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing. 

AS TO THE AMENDED COUNTS 2 & 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.   DNA notification given.   Any restitution will be determined at sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

filed.  Count 1:  Criminal Damage to Property, contrary to sec. 943.01 (1), 939.51(3)(a) Wis. Stats. a Class A Misdemeanor.  Count 2:  Operating a Motor Vehicle While Intoxicated - 2nd Offense, contrary to sec. 346.63(1)(a). 346.65(2)(am)2 Wis. Stats. a Misdemeanor.  Count 3:  Obstructing an Officer, contrary to sec. 946.41(1), 939.51(3)(a) Wis. Stats. a Class A Misdemeanor.

Attorney Kiley Zellner in court.  Lucy Kronforst for Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel informed the Court her client was here but never checked in with the deputies.  Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea date.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next scheduled court date.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in branch 26.  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kriston B Jones in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich appearing by telephone.  Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for Projected guilty plea.  Court in trial.   Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kriston B Jones in court.  James C. Griffin for Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel unavailable for today's proceedings.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kriston B Jones in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Ronald Dague for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 06-01-2015 at 08:30 am.
